name.description: The name of the app

icon.description: The icon hash of the app

rpc_origins.description: An array of rpc origin urls, if rpc is enabled

bot_public.description: When `false` only app owner can join the app's bot to guilds

bot_require_code_grant.description: When `true` the app's bot will only join upon completion of the full oauth2 code grant flow

terms_of_service_url.description: The url of the application's terms of service

privacy_policy_url.description: The url of the application's privacy policy

owner.description:
Partial user object containing info on the owner of the application

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/user#user-object

summary.description: If this application is a game sold on Discord, this field will be the summary field for the store page of its primary sku
summary.deprecated: Always an empty string, will be removed in v11

verify_key.description:
The hexadecimal encoded key for verification in interactions and the GameSDK's GetTicket function

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/game-sdk/applications#get-ticket

team.description:
The team this application belongs to

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/topics/teams#data-models-team-object

guild_id.description: If this application is a game sold on Discord, this field will be the guild to which it has been linked

primary_sku_id.description: If this application is a game sold on Discord, this field will be the id of the "Game SKU" that is created, if exists

slug.description: If this application is a game sold on Discord, this field will be the URL slug that links to the store page

cover_image.description: If this application is a game sold on Discord, this field will be the hash of the image on store embeds

username.description: The user's username, not unique across the platform

bot.description: Whether the user belongs to an OAuth2 application

system.description: Whether the user is an Official Discord System user (part of the urgent message system)

mfa_enabled.description: Whether the user has two factor enabled on their account

accent_color.description: The user's banner color encoded as an integer representation of hexadecimal color code

verified.description: Whether the email on this account has been verified

flags.description:
The flags on a user's account

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/user#user-object-user-flags

premium_type.description:
The type of Nitro subscription on a user's account

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/user#user-object-premium-types

public_flags.description:
The public flags on a user's account

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/user#user-object-user-flags

icon.description: A hash of the image of the team's icon

id.description: The unique id of the team

name.description: The name of the team

owner_user_id.description: The user id of the current team owner

membership_state.description:
The user's membership state on the team

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/topics/teams#data-models-membership-state-enum

team_id.description: The id of the parent team of which they are a member

user.description:
The avatar, discriminator, id, and username of the user

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/user#user-object

type.description:
The type of the channel

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#channel-object-channel-types

name.description: The name of the channel (2-100 characters)

APIPartialChannel.description: Not documented, but partial only includes id, name, and type

A direct message between multiple users

See https://support.discord.com/hc/en-us/articles/360032008192
A public thread channel within a Guild Text channel
A private thread channel within a Guild Text channel
A thread channel (public) within a Guild News channel

See https://support.discord.com/hc/en-us/articles/360032008192

type.description:
The type of the channel

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#channel-object-channel-types

name.description: The name of the channel (2-100 characters)

guild_id.description: The id of the guild (may be missing for some channel objects received over gateway guild dispatches)

permission_overwrites.description:
Explicit permission overwrites for members and roles

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#overwrite-object

parent_id.description:
ID of the parent category for a channel (each parent category can contain up to 50 channels)

OR

ID of the parent channel for a thread

last_message_id.description: The id of the last message sent in this channel (may not point to an existing or valid message)

default_auto_archive_duration.description: Default duration for newly created threads, in minutes, to automatically archive the thread after recent activity

last_pin_timestamp.description: When the last pinned message was pinned. This may be `null` in events such as `GUILD_CREATE` when a message is not pinned

rate_limit_per_user.description:
Amount of seconds a user has to wait before sending another message (0-21600); bots, as well as users with the permission `MANAGE_MESSAGES` or `MANAGE_CHANNELS`, are unaffected

`rate_limit_per_user` also applies to thread creation. Users can send one message and create one thread during each `rate_limit_per_user` interval.

For thread channels, `rate_limit_per_user` is only returned if the field is set to a non-zero and non-null value. The absence of this field in API calls and Gateway events should indicate that slowmode has been reset to the default value.

OR

ID of the parent channel for a thread

member.description: The client users member for the thread, only included in select endpoints

thread_metadata.description: The metadata for a thread channel not shared by other channels

message_count.description: The approximate message count of the thread, does not count above 50 even if there are more messages

member_count.description: The approximate member count of the thread, does not count above 50 even if there are more members

rate_limit_per_user.description:
Amount of seconds a user has to wait before sending another message (0-21600); bots, as well as users with the permission `MANAGE_MESSAGES` or `MANAGE_CHANNELS`, are unaffected

`rate_limit_per_user` also applies to thread creation. Users can send one message and create one thread during each `rate_limit_per_user` interval.

For thread channels, `rate_limit_per_user` is only returned if the field is set to a non-zero and non-null value. The absence of this field in API calls and Gateway events should indicate that slowmode has been reset to the default value.

APIChannelBase<(enum-1201128677-8430-851.description: This interface is used to allow easy extension for other channel types. While also allowing `APIPartialChannel` to be used without breaking.

id.description:
The id of the thread

**This field is omitted on the member sent within each thread in the `GUILD_CREATE` event**

user_id.description:
The id of the member

**This field is omitted on the member sent within each thread in the `GUILD_CREATE` event**

join_timestamp.description: An ISO8601 timestamp for when the member last joined

flags.description:
Member flags combined as a bitfield

See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bit_field

auto_archive_duration.description: Duration in minutes to automatically archive the thread after recent activity, can be set to: 60, 1440, 4320, 10080

archive_timestamp.description: An ISO8601 timestamp when the thread's archive status was last changed, used for calculating recent activity

locked.description: Whether the thread is locked; when a thread is locked, only users with `MANAGE_THREADS` can unarchive it

invitable.description: Whether non-moderators can add other non-moderators to the thread; only available on private threads

create_timestamp.description: Timestamp when the thread was created; only populated for threads created after 2022-01-09

channel_id.description: ID of the channel the message was sent in

guild_id.description: ID of the guild the message was sent in

author.description:
The author of this message (only a valid user in the case where the message is generated by a user or bot user)

If the message is generated by a webhook, the author object corresponds to the webhook's id, username, and avatar. You can tell if a message is generated by a webhook by checking for the `webhook_id` property

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/user#user-object

member.description:
Member properties for this message's author

The member object exists in `MESSAGE_CREATE` and `MESSAGE_UPDATE` events from text-based guild channels

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/guild#guild-member-object

edited_timestamp.description: When this message was edited (or null if never)

tts.description: Whether this was a TTS message

roles.description:
Array of role object ids

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/topics/permissions#role-object

joined_at.description: When the user joined the guild

premium_since.description:
When the user started boosting the guild

See https://support.discord.com/hc/en-us/articles/360028038352-Server-Boosting-

deaf.description: Whether the user is deafened in voice channels

mute.description: Whether the user is muted in voice channels

pending.description:
Whether the user has not yet passed the guild's Membership Screening requirements

*If this field is not present, it can be assumed as `false`.*

communication_disabled_until.description: Timestamp of when the time out will be removed; until then, they cannot interact with the guild

username.description: The user's username, not unique across the platform

bot.description: Whether the user belongs to an OAuth2 application

system.description: Whether the user is an Official Discord System user (part of the urgent message system)

mfa_enabled.description: Whether the user has two factor enabled on their account

accent_color.description: The user's banner color encoded as an integer representation of hexadecimal color code

verified.description: Whether the email on this account has been verified

flags.description:
The flags on a user's account

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/user#user-object-user-flags

premium_type.description:
The type of Nitro subscription on a user's account

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/user#user-object-premium-types

public_flags.description:
The public flags on a user's account

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/user#user-object-user-flags

mentions.description:
Users specifically mentioned in the message

The `member` field is only present in `MESSAGE_CREATE` and `MESSAGE_UPDATE` events from text-based guild channels

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/user#user-object See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/guild#guild-member-object

mention_roles.description:
Roles specifically mentioned in this message

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/topics/permissions#role-object

mention_channels.description:
Channels specifically mentioned in this message

Not all channel mentions in a message will appear in `mention_channels`.
- Only textual channels that are visible to everyone in a lurkable guild will ever be included
- Only crossposted messages (via Channel Following) currently include `mention_channels` at all

If no mentions in the message meet these requirements, this field will not be sent

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#channel-mention-object

nonce.description:
A nonce that can be used for optimistic message sending (up to 25 characters)

**You will not receive this from further fetches. This is received only once from a `MESSAGE_CREATE` event to ensure it got sent**

webhook_id.description: If the message is generated by a webhook, this is the webhook's id

type.description:
Type of message

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#message-object-message-types

activity.description:
Sent with Rich Presence-related chat embeds

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#message-object-message-activity-structure

name.description: The name of the app

icon.description: The icon hash of the app

rpc_origins.description: An array of rpc origin urls, if rpc is enabled

bot_public.description: When `false` only app owner can join the app's bot to guilds

bot_require_code_grant.description: When `true` the app's bot will only join upon completion of the full oauth2 code grant flow

terms_of_service_url.description: The url of the application's terms of service

privacy_policy_url.description: The url of the application's privacy policy

owner.description:
Partial user object containing info on the owner of the application

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/user#user-object

summary.description: If this application is a game sold on Discord, this field will be the summary field for the store page of its primary sku
summary.deprecated: Always an empty string, will be removed in v11

verify_key.description:
The hexadecimal encoded key for verification in interactions and the GameSDK's GetTicket function

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/game-sdk/applications#get-ticket

team.description:
The team this application belongs to

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/topics/teams#data-models-team-object

guild_id.description: If this application is a game sold on Discord, this field will be the guild to which it has been linked

primary_sku_id.description: If this application is a game sold on Discord, this field will be the id of the "Game SKU" that is created, if exists

slug.description: If this application is a game sold on Discord, this field will be the URL slug that links to the store page

cover_image.description: If this application is a game sold on Discord, this field will be the hash of the image on store embeds

application.description:
Sent with Rich Presence-related chat embeds

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#message-object-message-application-structure

application_id.description: If the message is a response to an Interaction, this is the id of the interaction's application

message_reference.description:
Reference data sent with crossposted messages, replies, pins, and thread starter messages

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#message-object-message-reference-structure

flags.description:
Message flags combined as a bitfield

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#message-object-message-flags

See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bit_field

referenced_message.description:
The message associated with the `message_reference`

This field is only returned for messages with a `type` of `19` (REPLY).

If the message is a reply but the `referenced_message` field is not present, the backend did not attempt to fetch the message that was being replied to, so its state is unknown.

If the field exists but is `null`, the referenced message was deleted

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#message-object

interaction.description: Sent if the message is a response to an Interaction

thread.description: Sent if a thread was started from this message

components.description: Sent if the message contains components like buttons, action rows, or other interactive components

sticker_items.description:
Sent if the message contains stickers

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/sticker#sticker-item-object

stickers.description:
The stickers sent with the message

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/sticker#sticker-object

user.description:
The user this guild member represents

**This field won't be included in the member object attached to `MESSAGE_CREATE` and `MESSAGE_UPDATE` gateway events.**

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/user#user-object

roles.description:
Array of role object ids

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/topics/permissions#role-object

joined_at.description: When the user joined the guild

premium_since.description:
When the user started boosting the guild

See https://support.discord.com/hc/en-us/articles/360028038352-Server-Boosting-

deaf.description: Whether the user is deafened in voice channels

mute.description: Whether the user is muted in voice channels

pending.description:
Whether the user has not yet passed the guild's Membership Screening requirements

*If this field is not present, it can be assumed as `false`.*

communication_disabled_until.description: Timestamp of when the time out will be removed; until then, they cannot interact with the guild

guild_id.description: ID of the guild containing the channel

type.description:
The type of channel

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#channel-object-channel-types

name.description: The name of the channel

content_type.description:
The attachment's media type

See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Media_type

title.description:
Title of embed

Length limit: 256 characters

type.description: Type of embed (always "rich" for webhook embeds)
type.deprecated:
*Embed types should be considered deprecated and might be removed in a future API version*

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#embed-object-embed-types

description.description:
Description of embed

Length limit: 4096 characters

fields.description:
Fields information

Length limit: 25 field objects

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#embed-object-embed-field-structure

EmbedType.deprecated: *Embed types should be considered deprecated and might be removed in a future API version*

proxy_url.description: A proxied url of the image

url.description: Source url of thumbnail (only supports http(s) and attachments)

proxy_url.description: A proxied url of the thumbnail

name.description: Name of provider

Name of author

Length limit: 256 characters

proxy_icon_url.description: A proxied url of author icon

name.description: Name of the guild (2-100 characters)

roles.description:
New guild roles

**When using this parameter, the first member of the array is used to change properties of the guild's @everyone role. If you are trying to bootstrap a guild with additional roles, keep this in mind.**

*When using this parameter, the required `id` field within each role object is an integer placeholder, and will be replaced by the API upon consumption. Its purpose is to allow you to overwrite a role's permissions in a channel when also passing in channels with the channels array.*

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/topics/permissions#role-object

channels.description:
New guild's channels

**When using the channels parameter, the `position` field is ignored, and none of the default channels are created.**

*When using the channels parameter, the `id` field within each channel object may be set to an integer placeholder, and will be replaced by the API upon consumption. Its purpose is to allow you to create `GUILD_CATEGORY` channels by setting the `parent_id` field on any children to the category's id field. Category channels must be listed before any children.*

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/channel#channel-object

system_channel_id.description: The id of the channel where guild notices such as welcome messages and boost events are posted

premium_progress_bar_enabled.description: Whether the boosts progress bar should be enabled.

permissions.description: Bitwise value of the enabled/disabled permissions

hoist.description: Whether the role should be displayed separately in the sidebar

icon.description: The role's icon image (if the guild has the `ROLE_ICONS` feature)

unicode_emoji.description: The role's unicode emoji as a standard emoji (if the guild has the `ROLE_ICONS` feature)

mentionable.description: Whether the role should be mentionable

**This field is not provided for `discord` bot integrations.**

enable_emoticons.description:
Whether emoticons should be synced for this integration (`twitch` only currently)

**This field is not provided for `discord` bot integrations.**

expire_behavior.description:
The behavior of expiring subscribers

**This field is not provided for `discord` bot integrations.**

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/guild#integration-object-integration-expire-behaviors

expire_grace_period.description:
The grace period (in days) before expiring subscribers

**This field is not provided for `discord` bot integrations.**

user.description:
User for this integration

**This field is not provided for `discord` bot integrations.**

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/user#user-object

synced_at.description:
When this integration was last synced

**This field is not provided for `discord` bot integrations.**

subscriber_count.description:
How many subscribers this integration has

**This field is not provided for `discord` bot integrations.**

revoked.description:
Has this integration been revoked

**This field is not provided for `discord` bot integrations.**

application.description:
The bot/OAuth2 application for discord integrations

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/guild#integration-application-object

**This field is not provided for `discord` bot integrations.**

integrations.description:
An array of partial server integrations

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/guild#integration-object

friend_sync.description: Whether friend sync is enabled for this connection

show_activity.description: Whether activities related to this connection will be shown in presence updates

name.description: Name of the account
The name of the app

icon.description:
The icon hash of the app

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/reference#image-formatting

summary.deprecated: Always an empty string, will be removed in v11

bot.description:
The bot associated with this application

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/user#user-object

guild_id.description: The guild id this voice state is for

channel_id.description: The channel id this user is connected to

user_id.description: The user id this voice state is for

member.description:
The guild member this voice state is for

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/guild#guild-member-object

session_id.description: The session id for this voice state

deaf.description: Whether this user is deafened by the server

mute.description: Whether this user is muted by the server

self_deaf.description: Whether this user is locally deafened

self_mute.description: Whether this user is locally muted

self_stream.description: Whether this user is streaming using "Go Live"

self_video.description: Whether this user's camera is enabled

suppress.description: Whether this user is muted by the current user

request_to_speak_timestamp.description: The time at which the user requested to speak

user.description:
The user this guild member represents

**This field won't be included in the member object attached to `MESSAGE_CREATE` and `MESSAGE_UPDATE` gateway events.**

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/user#user-object

roles.description:
Array of role object ids

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/topics/permissions#role-object

joined_at.description: When the user joined the guild

premium_since.description:
When the user started boosting the guild

See https://support.discord.com/hc/en-us/articles/360028038352-Server-Boosting-

deaf.description: Whether the user is deafened in voice channels

mute.description: Whether the user is muted in voice channels

pending.description:
Whether the user has not yet passed the guild's Membership Screening requirements

*If this field is not present, it can be assumed as `false`.*

communication_disabled_until.description: Timestamp of when the time out will be removed; until then, they cannot interact with the guild

username.description: The user's username, not unique across the platform

bot.description: Whether the user belongs to an OAuth2 application

system.description: Whether the user is an Official Discord System user (part of the urgent message system)

mfa_enabled.description: Whether the user has two factor enabled on their account

accent_color.description: The user's banner color encoded as an integer representation of hexadecimal color code

verified.description: Whether the email on this account has been verified

flags.description:
The flags on a user's account

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/user#user-object-user-flags

premium_type.description:
The type of Nitro subscription on a user's account

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/user#user-object-premium-types

public_flags.description:
The public flags on a user's account

See https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/user#user-object-user-flags

name.description: Name of the region

optimal.description: `true` for a single server that is closest to the current user's client

deprecated.description: Whether this is a deprecated voice region (avoid switching to these)

custom.description: Whether this is a custom voice region (used for events/etc)
